alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 7:17AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT GARRETT COUNTY... At 716 AM EST, an area of moderate to heavy snow is located around Grantsville to Mountain Lake Park and points north and west, including Interstate 68 across all of Garrett County. Winds in excess of 40 mph are expected with the snow, which will cause blowing and drifting snow. Visibility will be reduced to below one-quarter mile at times, and untreated surfaces will be snow covered and slippery. Please use extra caution when travelling this morning. Locations impacted include... Mountain Lake Park, Oakland, Bayard, Bittinger, Grantsville, Loch Lynn Heights, Friendsville, Deer Park, Accident, Redhouse, Hutton, Gorman, Jennings, Deep Creek Lake State Park, Crellin, Swallow Falls State Park, McHenry, Big Run State Park, Piney Grove, and McComas Beach. This includes Interstate 68 in Maryland between mile markers 1 and 29. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes.
